lessonSubtitleText: Test how well you know this story

questions.text: What happened to Jacob's family by the beginning of Exodus?
answers: They had grown into a great nation
They had disappeared completely
They had returned to Canaan
They all became blind

questions.text: Because he was afraid of the Israelites, what did Pharaoh do?
answers: Made them work hard as slaves
Sent them out of Egypt
Killed them
Begged them not to attack him

questions.text: What happened after Pharaoh made the Israelites his slaves?
answers: They grew even more
They stopped having children
They went to war with Pharaoh
They ran away from Egypt

questions.text: What did Pharaoh tell the midwives to do? What happened?
answers: To kill the baby boys; they didn't obey him
To report every birth; they obeyed
To help the families escape; they ran away
To steal the babies; they followed orders

questions.text: What final order did Pharaoh give?
answers: Throw the baby boys into the river
Send the families out of Egypt
Take the babies from their mothers
Stop the Israelites from marrying

questions.text: What did the young couple from the tribe of Levi do with their baby boy?
answers: Hid him for three months
Gave him to the Egyptians
Left him outside the city
Drew a mustache on him and pretended he was a grown-up

questions.text: When they couldn't hide him anymore, what did they do?
answers: Floated him in a basket in the Nile River
Sent him down the river alone
Sent him to live in a pyramid
Handed him to the soldiers

questions.text: Who found the baby? How did she feel?
answers: Pharaoh's daughter; she felt sorry for him
An Egyptian servant; she was angry
A fisherman; he was afraid
Moses' sister; she was confused

questions.text: What did the baby's sister Miriam say to Pharaoh's daughter?
answers: Do you want me to find someone to feed him?
We should leave him here
Let's hide him again
He belongs to my family

questions.text: After he no longer needed his mother's milk, what happened to the boy?
answers: He became the son of Pharaoh's daughter; she named him Moses
He returned to live with his parents
He was sent away from Egypt
He became a servant in the palace
